definitions.definition: the time of year when the crops are gathered in on a farm, etc.; the act of cutting and gathering crops

examples.text: Farmers are extremely busy during the harvest.
During the harvest they work from dawn to dusk.
Potatoes are normally sprayed after harvest.

definitions.definition: the crops, or the amount of crops, cut and gathered

examples.text: a **good/bad harvest** *(= a lot of crops or few crops)*
The appeal produced a rich harvest of blankets, medicines and clothing.
Plum growers say they are expecting a **bumper harvest** *(= a large amount of produce)* this year.
The strawberry harvest failed because of the drought.
They were busy getting the harvest in.
a series of poor harvests in the 1830s
She returned from the conference with a rich harvest of knowledge.

definitions.definition: to benefit or suffer as a direct result of something that you have done

wordOrigin: Old English hærfest ‘autumn’, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch herfst and German Herbst, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin carpere ‘pluck’ and Greek karpos ‘fruit’.
